description: Iconic yellow-flowering tree that attracts native birds.
potential issues: Can be messy when flowers drop

description: Sword-like leaves with tall flower spikes, important Māori resource.
potential issues: Sharp leaf edges can cut skin

description: New Zealand's Christmas tree with stunning red flowers in summer.
planting considerations: Needs space to grow, not for small gardens.

description: National symbol with silvery-white underside on fronds.
planting considerations: Needs protection from wind and frost when young.
potential issues: Fronds can be damaged by wind

description: Palm-like tree with long narrow leaves and scented flowers.
potential issues: Can be blown over in extreme winds

description: Small tree with white or pink flowers, famous for honey production.
planting considerations: Can spread aggressively in some areas.

description: Sweet potato with heart-shaped leaves, important Māori crop.
planting considerations: Needs warm soil to grow well.

description: Large evergreen tree with glossy leaves and red berries.
planting considerations: Needs large space, not for small gardens.

description: Bushy shrub with red-speckled leaves, known as pepper tree.
potential issues: Leaves can burn in full sun

description: Heart-shaped leaves used in Māori medicine, with yellow spikes.
planting considerations: Often has insect holes in leaves - this is natural.

description: Large forest tree with purple berries loved by kererū.
planting considerations: Needs space and time to grow.

description: Similar to mānuka but with smaller leaves and white flowers.
New Zealand's only native palm with graceful fronds.
planting considerations: Very slow growing - buy largest you can afford.

description: Shiny-leaved shrubs with colorful berries in many varieties.
planting considerations: Many varieties available - choose for your purpose.

description: Twining vine with small leaves, great for covering fences.
Clumping plants with strappy leaves and white flowers.
potential issues: Can look messy when not flowering
May need dividing to maintain vigor

description: Small tree with bright red flowers in summer (similar to pohutukawa but smaller).
planting considerations: Prune after flowering to maintain shape.

description: Evergreen shrubs with spikes of flowers, many varieties available.
planting considerations: Prune after flowering to maintain shape.
potential issues: May need protection from extreme frost

description: Tall tree with distinctive spiky flowers and serrated leaves.
Dense shrub with small leaves and white bell-shaped flowers.
Spreading edible plant with thick triangular leaves.
planting considerations: Pick leaves regularly to encourage growth.

description: Evergreen shrub with sweet aromatic fruit, popular in home gardens.
planting considerations: Plant two varieties for better fruiting.
potential issues: May need netting to protect fruit

description: Tropical-looking plant with large leaves, grown for edible corms.
Native vine with orange fruit, different from commercial passionfruit.
potential issues: Fruit not as tasty as commercial passionfruit

description: Coastal tree with large orange berries, important Māori food source (when processed).
Unique tree with peeling bark and purple-green flowers.
Tropical-looking tree with huge glossy leaves.
Shrub with lilac-like flowers and soft leaves.
potential issues: May need protection from harsh winds

description: Tall forest tree with slender form and important timber.
planting considerations: Needs space and time to grow.

description: Twining vine with fragrant white flowers.
Small tree with purple berries and attractive bark.
planting considerations: Good for quick cover in new gardens.

description: Shrub with small rounded leaves and attractive bark.
potential issues: May need frost protection when young

description: Clumping plant with strappy leaves and white flowers.
potential issues: Can look messy when not flowering
May need dividing to maintain vigor

description: Handsome tree with red fruit and shiny leaves.
Small shrubs with clusters of fragrant flowers.
Small tree with reddish stems and small leaves.
Small trees with white flowers and attractive bark.
Climbing plant with edible fruit, used for weaving.
Aromatic herb with red flowers and pineapple-scented leaves.
Spreading edible plant with thick triangular leaves, salt-tolerant.
planting considerations: Pick leaves regularly to encourage growth.

description: Unique tree with flattened stems instead of leaves, slow-growing.
Fast-growing small tree with distinctive five-fingered leaves.
planting considerations: Good for quick cover in new gardens.

description: Succulent groundcover with pink flowers, excellent for coastal areas.
Clumping plant with blue berries and strappy leaves.
potential issues: Can look messy when not fruiting
May need frost protection when young

description: Twining vine with fragrant white flowers.
Clumping plant with strappy leaves and white flowers, drought-tolerant.

May need dividing to maintain vigor

description: Small shrubs with clusters of fragrant flowers, many endangered species.
Traditional Māori staple crop with heart-shaped leaves and sweet, starchy tubers.
planting considerations: Requires warm soil (min 18°C); plant after last frost
special_care: Lift tubers before first frost
storage_ability: Excellent (4-6 months in cool, dark place)

description: Tropical plant with large elephant-ear leaves and edible starchy corms.
planting considerations: Needs constant moisture; toxic when raw
special_care: Protect from frost
storage_ability: Good (2-3 months in cool, humid conditions)

description: Heritage potatoes with colorful flesh and unique flavors.
special_care: Hill soil around stems as plants grow
storage_ability: Good (2-4 months in cool, dark place)
watering_needs: Consistent moisture, especially during tuber formation

description: Salt-tolerant leafy green with triangular leaves, different from regular spinach.
special_care: Pinch tips to encourage bushiness

description: Andean tuber with crisp, sweet roots that can be eaten raw or cooked.
special_care: Harvest after first frost sweetens tubers
storage_ability: Excellent (4-6 months in cool, dark place)

description: Colorful Andean tuber with lemon-flavored leaves and starchy roots.
special_care: Leaves contain oxalic acid - consume in moderation
storage_ability: Good (3-4 months in cool, dark place)

description: Climbing vine producing large edible tubers, traditional Māori food.
special_care: Tubers can grow very large - allow space
storage_ability: Good (3-5 months in cool, dark place)

description: Peppery aquatic green rich in vitamins, grows in running water.
special_care: Ensure water source is uncontaminated
watering_needs: Constant submersion or very wet soil

description: Cold-tolerant legume that fixes nitrogen in soil.
planting considerations: Pinch out tops to deter blackfly
special_care: Provide support in windy areas

description: Popular NZ variety with sweet, dense orange flesh.
special_care: Harvest before first frost with stem attached
storage_ability: Excellent (6+ months in cool, dry place)

description: Early-maturing pea varieties suited to NZ conditions.
special_care: Pick regularly to encourage more pods

description: Tall sunflower relative producing edible tubers.
special_care: Harvest after frost for sweeter flavor

description: Crisp-stemmed variety adapted to NZ growing conditions.
special_care: Blanch stems by wrapping to reduce bitterness

description: Perennial vegetable producing edible spears each spring.
special_care: Don't harvest first year after planting

description: Cold-hardy perennial with tart, edible stalks.
planting considerations: Leaves are poisonous - only eat stalks
special_care: Divide every 4-5 years

description: Ornamental perennial producing edible flower buds.
planting considerations: Needs space and time to establish
special_care: Protect crowns in very cold winters

description: Hardy perennial with bitter leaves and edible roots.
special_care: Blanch leaves to reduce bitterness

description: Cold-hardy leafy green with improved NZ cultivars.
special_care: Netting prevents white butterfly damage

description: Perennial spinach alternative with thick, fleshy leaves.
special_care: Remove flower stalks to prolong leaf production

description: Mild-flavored allium with long white stems.
planting considerations: Plant deep for long white stems
special_care: Hill soil around stems to blanch
